intro: Chrysanthemum hypoleucum, commonly known as the white chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China and Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and yellow to white flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
